e_data.head: Prompt
e_data.msg: Many parents struggle to find the best tutors for the educational needs of their children. Parents discover tutors by soliciting recommendations from other parents at their children's school. Parents have no clue what topics the tutors are skilled at teaching, or if they are instructors at all.

e_data.head: Challenge
e_data.msg: Design a application to help the users find best and certified tutors around for their children who offer online and offline classes.

e_data.head: What Brilliant offers?
e_data.msg:
Brilliant is designed to simplify the process of finding tutors near you. Many parents struggle to find the best tutors for the educational needs of their children.

To solve this problem I have implemented a simple UI/UX design solution that displays all the certified, top tutors near the users area and the users can request for trial classes from the tutors and then pay the total fee.

Additionally, I have included a Add notes feature where tutors can add exclusive notes of the lessons they are about to teach in the upcoming classes. Using the Assignment submission feature students can submit their assignments through the application and are notified about the deadline as well.
With these features Brilliant is designed to create a hassle free experience for the users to find the top tutors around them.

col.msg:
Brilliant offers a efficient solution for the common problem that the users face like the difficulty in finding tutors for their kids who are the best at their work. This app simplifies the process of finding tutors around the users area and enhances the customer experience.

With this application, customers can easily search for tutors around their household, eliminating the idea of blindly trusting someone else’s words as users can request for trial classes before deciding to join.

Additionally add notes and assignment submission feature creates a hassle free process for the students to refer their notes and submit their assignments.

This app makes it easy for you to find the best tutors around eliminating the solicitation of recommendations from other parents at their children's school having no clue on what the tutors are really proficient at.
People in the age group of 40-55 years as its the general age of the parents having kids ranging from 14-18 years of age.
People with children having lower grades.
Add trial class feature to eliminate the blind trust on tutors
Submit assignment and download notes
Locate tuitions near users

The idea of the product is to allow the customers to easily search for tutors near their home eliminating the trouble of searching for tutors.

The goal was to provide customers with an easy method to identify tutors and attend trial lessons so that consumers could decide whether or not to enroll in full-time programs.

I conducted a usability test with a group of potential consumers to check the application's functionality and identify issues. This implied monitoring individuals while they engaged with the prototype and collected feedback on their experience. Through this approach, I acquired useful insights that assisted me in identifying areas for development and making essential tweaks to better the user experience.

Key Takeaways

Here are some of the key takeaways from our guerrilla user testing sessions.

The colour scheme used didn’t make me feel like I am using some kind of an education app.I really liked the idea of showing the story of the tuitions. It gave me the confidence that my kid will succeed like so one day.I loved using the trial class feature as it helped me and my child in deciding which tutor would be the best.It would be helpful to have more information about the tutors for each subjects and the fee.The process of finding nearby tutors was very easy to use.

Once the initial flow was completed and the wireframes were ready, I started creating a couple of main screens for the app. Choosing the typeface and the set of colours were the two most significant tasks. I created a simple UI style guide to maintain consistency.Then I created a typography scale to ensure that hierarchy is preserved throughout the project.

Colors
Primary
Secondary

Typeface
Open Sans
Bold, Regular
Aa Aa

Build trust
With the insightful journey videos of the tuitions, users eventually gained trust on the classes.

e_data.head: Design Iteration
e_data.msg:
During the iterative design process, I received feedback from users that the colour scheme used didn’t make them feel like they were using an education app. I decided to experiment with different colours which could make the users feel reliable. I also adjusted the typography to ensure that it was clear and easy to read.

Another area I iteratively improved upon was the choice of icons used in the app. I initially used a clumsy course icon for the courses page on the menu bar which made some users take extra time to figure out what the actual icon was. I then designed a simple book icon which helped users quickly understand the functionality of the app.

In addition to these changes, I iteratively refined other design elements such as the layout of the tuition page where the tutors name and image was displayed. Further addition of a video which portrays success story of the institution helped build trust with the customers.

Each iteration was made by user feedback, with the goal of making the app more user-friendly, visually appealing, and effective at helping users choose the best tutors easily.

By using an iterative design process, I was able to make incremental improvements to the app over time, leading to a final design that effectively met the needs and preferences of our users.

e_data.head: Project Overview
e_data.msg: There are many transportation services for adults but there is none or a few for kids. Generally parents send their kids in the cab as what the school provides or where the kids schoolmates opt to. There seems to be no other way for the parents to find cabs for their kids. In order to fulfill this need I thought of creating an application that bridges the gap between parents and the cab drivers while ensuring a safe journey for kids. The goal is to create an easy-to-use and secure transportation application for an upcoming company called KidCabs, which caters to children in India's Tier 1 cities. The challenge is to ensure that children are safe in the cab, are readily picked up, and arrive at their destination while giving parents complete control and peace of mind.

e_data.head: Phase 1 - Discover
e_data.msg:
When I dove deep into the proposed product, I decided to study the audience by doing a user research and it was an interesting yet a challenging task. They shared a lot of scenarios out of which there arised many questions in my mind.
Who are the people we are designing for?

-> Parents who are between the age group 30-70.
-> Parents who are busy with their household and professional chores.
-> Parents who are old aged having blurred vision.
-> Protective female parents who only care about safety of their children.
What are their pain points when it comes to finding or booking cabs for their children?

-> Safety - To ensure kids safety. Safety precautions like some sort of in-app emergency services.
-> Recurring Rides - To book recurring rides for their kids. For example, specific dates or for a month or so.
-> Reminders - To get notified beforehand about the scheduled ride and also before the ride arrives that is when a cab enters a 2km radius.
-> Parental Controls - To make sure my kids don't book a cab without my knowledge.
-> Easy UI - Easy to use interfaces that anyone can use regardless of the age.
Key Needs

a) User needs to book cab for their kids while ensuring their safety.
b) User needs to book cab on a recurring basis.
c) User needs to easily book cab despite not knowing how to use such applications.
d) User needs to verify the booking made by their children.

col.msg: The methodoly I followed to solve the problem was ideation, User Personas, User Journey maps and Low-fidelity wireframes.

Ideation
After understanding the user scenarios, I decided to decode their user journeys and ideated my decisions about the approach of the app. Creating two apps, one for parents and one for kids was the game changer that addresses all the user needs by providing parental controls, safety and an extra layer of precaution. My thought process was to design a parents app using which users can book cabs, allow access to their children, set custom alerts like geofencing, loud noise, overspeeding, route deviation. They can also select the favourite locations for their kids so that their kida can book cabs only to and from those locations. The main feature of the parents app is that they get to verify whenever their kid books a ride so that they don't travel anywhere without their parents knowledge.

User Personas
After analysing the user needs, I mapped four personas according to the prioritization. I carefully created four personas without adding my own assumptions about the project.

Goals
By observing the user journey of all the personas, I mapped their respective motives of using the Kidcabs app. The main goals of the project were,
a) A safe and secure transportation service for female kids.
b) A transport app that allows the user to make recurring bookings at a time for a month or so and reminds them about the ride.
c) A easy to use transport app that notifies when the user’s grand kid gets picked up or dropped as the user is aged and has blurred vision.
d) A secure transport app that does not allow her kids to book cab without her permission.

Low-Fidelity Wireframes
After the brainstorming session about the user scenarios and their journeys, I mapped the user journeys in my mind and designed the initial wireframes of the application. The goal was to fulfill the necessity of the users to book a cab service for their kids easily and also to make sure that they are safe. Through rapid sketching, I explored a variety of layouts and interaction patterns ensuring that the app felt more trustworthy. This iterative method made it easier to find design components that parents could easily navigate and interact with.

Once the initial flow was completed and the wireframes were ready, I started creating a couple of main screens for the app. Choosing the typeface and the set of colours were the two most significant tasks. I created a simple UI style guide to maintain consistency. Then I created a typography scale to ensure that hierarchy is preserved throughout the project.

Colors
Primary
Secondary

Typeface
Poppins
Semibold, Medium, Regular
Aa Aa

Build trust
With the safety precautions we provide and our 16 step verification process we can establish a sense of trust amongst the users.

I tested the usability of the lofi-prototype with a group of prospective users in order to determine its functionality and spot any problems. This included keeping an eye on people while they interacted with the prototype and gathering input about their initial thoughts. I gained insightful knowledge using this approach, which helped me pinpoint areas that needed improvement and make crucial adjustments to enhance the user experience.

Key Takeaways

Here are some of the key takeaways from the user testing sessions.

Can add a new page for making payment in parent app.Geofencing feature was impressive.Favourites icon in the parent app is confusing.Safety features looks great. UI looks impressive.Verifying the driver’s identity is easy. Selecting date is bit tough.

e_data.head: Design Iteration
e_data.msg:
During the iterative design process, I received feedback from users that the favourites location icon was confusing as it moved from right to left while clicking on it. So I decided to keep the favourites location icon in the same place even after the users click on it.

Another area I iteratively improved upon was to add a separate confirmation, payments page so that the users donot book cabs at fault. Adding parental controls in the app ensures that the kids donot book cabs by themselves and go by their own wish. Parents need to verify each and every trip a kid books without which a trip is not confirmed. This adds an extra layer of safety, awareness to kids and parents.

In addition to these changes, I received feedback from the users of the kids app that selecting dates was confusing. So I brought in the thought of the good old calendar which the kids will be aware of instead of the shorter and cleaner calendar UI that I designed for the adults. Further addition of 16-step verification feature and our safety precautions like geofencing, emergency SOS, cameras helps to build trust with the customers.

Each iteration was made by user feedback, with the goal of making the app more user-friendly, visually appealing, and effective at helping users book the cabs easily.

By using an iterative design process, I was able to make incremental improvements to the app over time, leading to a final design that effectively met the needs and preferences of our users.

e_data.head: Project Overview
e_data.msg: A client approached me to design a website for their cake startup that they had launched recently. Its a home grown brand and they make cakes that look very exotic and taste yummy as well. The project was to design a beautiful user interface and user experience. I thought of adding that happy and creamy feeling when we look at a cake and the decor we see on top of the cake through out the website.

e_data.head: Phase 1 - Discover
e_data.msg:
When I dove deep into the proposed product, I decided to study the audience by doing a user research and it was an interesting task. The client wanted few features in the website like online payment option, delivery etc and shared some insights about their users.
Who are the people we are designing for?

-> People who are between the age group 15-70.
-> People who are busy with their household and professional chores.

What are their pain points when it comes to ordering cakes?

-> Date and Time - To ensure that the cake is delivered in the mentioned date and time.
-> Easy Refund - To get refund easily if the cake is damaged or having any quality issues.
-> Customize Cakes - To get teh cakes customized according to our likeliness.

Key Needs

a) User needs to get the cake delivered at the mentioned date and time.
b) User needs to get easy refunds if the cake is damaged or having any quality issues after getting delivered.
c) User needs to customize their cakes like choosing eggless cakes.

col.msg: The methodoly I followed to solve the problem was ideation, user goals and low-fidelity wireframes.

Ideation
After understanding the user needs, I decided to decode their user journeys and ideated my decisions about the approach of the website. Prioritizing the idea of locking in the happy and creamy feeling while looking at a cake, I decided to create a minimal website as the client had limited options of cake.

Goals
By observing the user journey of all the personas, I mapped their respective motives of using the Kidcabs app. The main goals of the project were,
a) Cake should be delivered in the mentioned date and time.
b) Refunds should be provided if there is any damage or quality issues while receiving the cake.
c) Customization options like being able to choose egg or eggless cake.

Low-Fidelity Wireframes
After the brainstorming session about the user scenarios and their journeys, I mapped the user journeys in my mind and designed the initial wireframes of the website with the hierarchical approach. The goal was to fulfill the necessity of the users to order a cake easily. Through rapid sketching, I explored a variety of layouts and interaction patterns ensuring that the app felt more trustworthy and warm. This iterative method made it easier to find design components that the users could easily navigate and interact with.

Once the initial flow was completed and the wireframes were ready, I started creating a couple of main screens for the website. Choosing the typeface and the set of colours were the two most significant tasks. I chose a attractive font to inculcate the authenticity of a cake website and matched it with a normal font. This gave that extra magic touch to the website and made it look more pleasing. I created a simple UI style guide to maintain consistency. Then I created a typography scale to ensure that hierarchy is preserved throughout the project.
